DOCNAME: DE PELLIER v. POLAND AND UKRAINE
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in Gdańsk .

Before the Second World War the applicant 's family owned real property in the eastern provinces of pre - war GPE , the so - called “ LOC ” ( GPE ) . Those regions included large areas of DATE GPE and GPE and territories around GPE in what is now GPE . In DATE the regions were invaded by the GPE .
Following the end of the war , when the NORP eastern border was redrawn westwards and fixed along LOC , the PERSON acquired the name of the “ territories beyond the LOC ” ( ziemie zabużańskie ) .

On an unspecified date following DATE the applicant 's family , like CARDINAL other NORP citizens who were at various dates DATE subject to repatriation from the territories beyond LOC , was repatriated to GPE under the provisions of the so - called “ NORP Agreements ” ( umowy republikańskie ) .

A more detailed account of the historical background and the relevant provisions of the NORP Agreements and other related treaties and laws can be found in the ORG 's judgment in the pilot case of PERSON v. GPE ( see , in particular , PERSON v. GPE [ ORG ] , no . PERSON , ECHR GPE , § § CARDINAL and DATE ) .

On DATE the ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) gave a declaratory judgment stating that the applicant had owned real property of substantial value in the territories beyond LOC . The property consisted of , in particular , CARDINAL factories , CARDINAL hotels , and CARDINAL cinema , all located in GPE .

On DATE ORG ( ORG ) informed him that his claim for compensation had been entered in the relevant register as claim no . CARDINAL but its realisation depended on the adoption of future measures by ORG in respect of LOC claims .

The applicant 's subsequent attempts to acquire ORG property were unsuccessful . The only possibility of enforcing the claim was to participate in competitive bids for the sale of ORG property . However , the ORG authorities throughout GPE officially acknowledged the acute shortage of ORG - owned land designated for the realisation of the LOC claims .

This fact and the fact that at the material time it was the authorities ' common practice to desist from organising auctions for LOC claimants or to openly deny them the opportunity to enforce their entitlement through the statutory bidding procedure was established by ORG in the PERSON judgment ( see PERSON , cited above , § § DATE , CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
In DATE the applicant wrote letters to ORG in GPE , and to the President of PERSON asking for help in obtaining compensation for the property .
In DATE the applicant wrote a letter to the President of GPE complaining about his situation .

A detailed description of the relevant domestic law and practice concerning the LOC property is set out in the judgments delivered by ORG in the pilot case of PERSON v. GPE ( see PERSON v. GPE ( merits ) , cited above § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL ; and PERSON v. GPE ( friendly settlement ) , cited above , § § DATE ) and the decisions given in the cases of GPE and Others v. GPE and GPE - Toboła v. GPE , cited above , § § CARDINAL and § § DATE respectively .

The operation of the compensation scheme introduced by DATE Act is described in the ORG 's decisions given in the cases of GPE and Others v. GPE DATE . ) no . CARDINAL , DATE , § § DATE and GPE - Toboła v. GPE DATE . ) no . CARDINAL , DATE , § § CARDINAL .
